==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|は|しゅ}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=はしゅ}} compound {{m|zh|把手|tr=pæ<sup>X</sup> syuw<sup>X</sup>|lit=hold + hand}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|はしゅ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はしゅ}}

# [[grip]], [[handle]], [[knob]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=とりて|取り|tr1=tori|t1=taking|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|取る}} ''toru'' “to take”|手|tr2=te|t2=hand}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> The {{lang|ja|把}} spelling for the ''tori'' portion is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]].

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|とりて|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|とりて}}

# [[grip]], [[handle]], [[knob]]
# a [[starting]] [[point]] (compare the English phrase {{m|en|get a handle on}})
# someone who [[take]]s or [[receive]]s something

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr}}
{{IPAchar|/torite/}} → {{IPAchar|/totte/}}

Alteration from ''torite'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|とって|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=3|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|とって}}

# [[grip]], [[handle]], [[knob]]
# a [[starting]] [[point]] (compare the English phrase {{m|en|get a handle on}})

=====Usage notes=====
The ''totte'' reading appears to be more common for the {{m|en|grip}}, {{m|en|handle}} sense.
